questions.question: What is the primary function of the cerebrum in the human brain?

What is the role of the hypothalamus in the human body?

options: Consists of cranial and spinal nerves
Contains autonomic and peripheral nervous systems

questions.question: What is the purpose of the choroid layer in the human eye?
options: Refracts light to form a clear image
Rich in blood vessels and provides nutrients to the eye
Controls the amount of light entering the eye
questions.correctAnswer: Rich in blood vessels and provides nutrients to the eye

questions.question: Which part of the eye contains the photoreceptor cells responsible for vision?
What is the function of the cochlea in the human ear?
options: Converts sound vibrations into electrical signals
questions.correctAnswer: Converts sound vibrations into electrical signals

questions.question: Which adaptation helps humans regulate body temperature?
What does the term 'homeostasis' refer to in biological systems?
Which hormone is responsible for the fight-or-flight response in humans?
What is the primary function of the myelin sheath in nerve cells?
options: Speeds up the transmission of nerve impulses
questions.correctAnswer: Speeds up the transmission of nerve impulses

questions.question: Which part of the human brain is responsible for processing visual information?
What is the purpose of the Eustachian tube in the human ear?
options: Equalizes pressure between the ear and the atmosphere
questions.correctAnswer: Equalizes pressure between the ear and the atmosphere

options: Regulates the amount of light entering the eye
Forms clear images on the retina
questions.correctAnswer: Regulates the amount of light entering the eye

questions.question: How do photoreceptor cells in the retina respond to light?
options: Produce hormones in response to light
Secrete enzymes to digest light particles

options: Cushions and protects the brain and spinal cord
questions.correctAnswer: Cushions and protects the brain and spinal cord

options: Regulates blood flow in the ear

options: Transmits sound signals to the brain
questions.correctAnswer: Transmits sound signals to the brain

Cushions the eye and maintains its shape
